input.rawText: Chest pain radiating to L arm for 3 days; exertional dyspnea.

soap.Subjective: Chest pain radiating to L arm for 3 days, exertional dyspnea. Patient reports significant quality of chest discomfort.
soap.Objective:
HTN (140/90 mmHg), tachycardia (98 bpm), and tachypnea (20 breaths/min).
Vitals: BP=140/90, HR=98, RR=20
Labs: Troponin=Not provided
soap.Assessment: ACS risk is high due to family history of MI at 52, smoking status, and exertional dyspnea. ECG and troponin results are pending.
soap.Plan: Continue monitoring for worsening symptoms. Order ECG and troponin tests as soon as possible to rule out ACS.
